intro: Abutilon densevillosum, commonly known as the woolly abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its densely hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, lantern-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Abutilon densevillosum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms.

It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. It is also present in parts of New Mexico and Arizona, where it grows in open woodlands and grasslands.
